remarks: Two ways to say a mapping from metric ` C ` to metric ` D ` is continuous at point ` P ` .  The distance arguments are swapped compared to ~ metcnp (and Munkres' ~ metcn ) for compatibility with ~ df-lm . Definition 1.3-3 of [Kreyszig] p. 20.  (Contributed by NM, 4-Jun-2007.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 13-Nov-2013.)
statement:
metcn.2 $e |- J = ( MetOpen ` C ) $.
metcn.4 $e |- K = ( MetOpen ` D ) $.
metcnp2 $p |- ( ( C e. ( *Met ` X ) /\ D e. ( *Met ` Y ) /\ P e. X ) -> ( F e. ( ( J CnP K ) ` P ) <-> ( F : X --> Y /\ A. y e. RR+ E. z e. RR+ A. w e. X ( ( w C P ) < z -> ( ( F ` w ) D ( F ` P ) ) < y ) ) ) ) $.
$d C w y z $.
$d D w y z $.
$d F w y z $.
$d J w y z $.
$d K w y z $.
$d P w y z $.
$d X w y z $.
$d Y w y z $.
